meanings.definition: The quality or state of being what or of existing as a particular thing.
meanings.sent1: The whatnesses of the mysterious object puzzled the detective.
meanings.sent2: She pondered the whatnesses of the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent3: The whatnesses of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The whatnesses of her personality shone like a bright light.
meanings.sent5: The whatnesses of the secret kept everyone guessing.

meanings.definition: The essential nature or character of something.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the whatnesses of a problem is crucial for solving it.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the whatnesses of the landscape in her painting.
meanings.sent3: The whatnesses of his favorite food always made him smile.
meanings.sent4: The whatnesses of the melody touched her heart deeply.
meanings.sent5: The whatnesses of the story stayed with her long after she read it.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being distinct or unique.
meanings.sent1: The whatnesses of her voice made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: Each snowflake has its own whatnesses, just like people.
meanings.sent3: The whatnesses of the rare flower amazed the botanist.
meanings.sent4: The whatnesses of the starry night sky filled him with wonder.
meanings.sent5: The whatnesses of the handmade gift made it truly special.
